discussion.content: This description suggests that this suspicious traffic is related to the new app. The easiest way to confirm that this is a FP is to investigate the dest IP and what are the processes that generate the traffic. C.

choices.A: Update all antivirus and anti-malware products, as well as all other host-based security software on the servers the affected users authenticate to.
choices.D: Ask desktop support personnel to reimage all affected workstations and reinstall the graphic design suite. Run a virus scan to identify if any viruses are present.
choices.B: Perform a network scan and identify rogue devices that may be generating the observed traffic. Remove those devices from the network.
choices.C: Identify what the destination IP address is and who owns it, and look at running processes on the affected hosts to determine if the activity is malicious or not.

questions.question_text: While reviewing proxy logs, the security analyst noticed a suspicious traffic pattern. Several internal hosts were observed communicating with an external IP address over port 80 constantly. An incident was declared, and an investigation was launched. After interviewing the affected users, the analyst determined the activity started right after deploying a new graphic design suite. Based on this information, which of the following actions would be the appropriate NEXT step in the investigation?

discussion.content: If you picked D then think about it - the chain of custody form should already be there. After the image we always hash it to see if we got a good error free image.
The answer is C
you want to compare the hash to see if anything was changed.

questions.question_text: A security analyst has created an image of a drive from an incident. Which of the following describes what the analyst should do NEXT?

choices.B: The analyst should begin analyzing the image and begin to report findings.
choices.A: The analyst should create a backup of the drive and then hash the drive.
choices.D: The analyst should create a chain of custody document and notify stakeholders.
choices.C: The analyst should create a hash of the image and compare it to the original drive's hash.

discussion.content: sending email won't prevent users from sharing usernames and passwords. there are plenty of users who dont read emails :D. A is a better choice and the solution should be configured to prevent the issue

comments.content: Agree the question is which of the following would ELIMINATE, i dont think a simple email to users would do that.

Read the question again..the company already invested 10% of its entire budget just for security technologies alone and looking likely not to add another investment but use a non cost method to solve the issue of sharing passwords and usernames which is an internal problem and not an attack...best method without investing more again in security technology to try and eliminate that internal problem is via Sending emails to users to stop sharing their passwords and usernames and probably re activate the AUP to them.

discussion.content: If you are logged as yourself and no-one knows your password - that is non-repudiation. If everyone share passwords, no one can tell who did what. C will definitely not change anything - they are already doing it (most likely with an AUP for it - but there is no mention of that). Answer: A.
password sharing is not related to non-repudiation. Password sharing can be lessen or eliminated by user awareness which can be done via training or a simple email from the security team
If they don't do this on purpose then C could be right as it is creating awareness. However if they do it willingly they have to answer to sr. management (D)
The question does not ask to stop the practice, but to "eliminate the risk introduced by this practice." Maybe there is no way the employees can work without sharing password?
yeah. it should be A
Should be A... Invest on MFA or PIM...

questions.question_text: A company invested ten percent of its entire annual budget in security technologies. The Chief Information Officer (CIO) is convinced that, without this investment, the company will risk being the next victim of the same cyber attack its competitor experienced three months ago. However, despite this investment, users are sharing their usernames and passwords with their coworkers to get their jobs done. Which of the following will eliminate the risk introduced by this practice?

choices.D: Run a report on all users sharing their credentials and alert their managers of further actions
choices.C: Send an email asking users not to share their credentials
choices.A: Invest in and implement a solution to ensure non-repudiation

questions.question_text: A SIEM analyst noticed a spike in activities from the guest wireless network to several electronic health record (EHR) systems. After further analysis, the analyst discovered that a large volume of data has been uploaded to a cloud provider in the last six months. Which of the following actions should the analyst do FIRST?

discussion.content: This should be activating the incident response plan. Putting an ACL on the gateway router will be performed during the incident response process

comments.content: I think it depends on the organization. Can you not have an IRP for operation use? I think IRP can even be used with SOC tier I, where you need to contain the problem as well as finding the root cause. IRP is not BCP, which requires activation from the management.

discussion.content:
Answer is D...
The security analyst needs to first put a block to potential continued exfiltration of data by activating the ACL before initiating incidence response.What if ACL is not put in place immediately and within the period of getting management approval for incidence response more data is exfiltrated....logically

Here is why this is D. If you read the question, what has happened is someone used the guest network to reach out and own some EHR systems then throw the data up on the cloud. The analyst wants to put an ACL on his router so that his network isn't the jumping off point next time.

I think the catch word here is guest wireless network, meaning users on the network are just guest, and also considering the importance of data being exfiltrated for the past 6 months, large volume of data. IMO i would say the best thing the do at the time is putting an ACL on the router interface for the guest wireless network to stop the data exfiltration

comments.content: We don't even know that leak is personal information. It could be logs of the EHR system.

discussion.content: I believe B should be the correct answer. Informing the CPO will allow them decide the next action to take. Putting an ACL without authorisation could lead to service failure and put the SIEM analyst at risk of losing their job.

IRP would not be activated by the analyst. That is something that management would do.
B looks a good one in this case. An analyst would notify the management about the unusual activity.
This is a guest network; so, it should not impact your prod network.
This should be C
C is correct.
Would it not be C as this would probably tell you to do D first anyway?

choices.D: Put an ACL on the gateway router
choices.A: Contact the Office of Civil Rights (OCR) to report the breach

discussion.content:
This should be D.

A. The company should contact the upstream ISP and ask that RFC1918 traffic be dropped. - RFC 1918 addresses shouldn't be coming from outside since they are not publicly routable.
B. The company should implement a network-based sinkhole to drop all traffic coming from 192.168.1.1 at their gateway router. - not needed since traffic from private IP addresses shouln't be coming from their gateway router
C. The company should implement the following ACL at their gateway firewall: DENY IP HOST 192.168.1.1 170.43.30.0/24. - same as b
D. The company should enable the DoS resource starvation protection feature of the gateway NIPS. - should protect the company from DOS attacks

choices.B: The company should implement a network-based sinkhole to drop all traffic coming from 192.168.1.1 at their gateway router.
choices.A: The company should contact the upstream ISP and ask that RFC1918 traffic be dropped.
choices.C: The company should implement the following ACL at their gateway firewall: DENY IP HOST 192.168.1.1 170.43.30.0/24.
choices.D: The company should enable the DoS resource starvation protection feature of the gateway NIPS.
